Running the test suite is optional. If there are failures, e.g. test-parse-date.t, those tests can be disabled. To test the results in the subdiretory tests/tmp, skipping failing tests, issue:

screen.userinput: cat > tests/blacklists/failed-tests << "EOF" # Test Failures test-parse-date.t EOF rm -rf tests/tmp && TESTFLAGS="-j<N> --tmpdir tmp --blacklist blacklists/failed-tests" \ make check

sect2.para: where <N> is an integer between one and the number of processor threads, inclusive. In order to investigate a particular apparently failing test, e.g test-parse-date.t, issue the following commands (notice that omitting --debug sometimes modifies the result):

screen.userinput: pushd tests && rm -rf tmp && ./run-tests.py --debug --tmpdir tmp test-parse-date.t && popd
